title: BD Influx Cell Sorter Start Up and Shut Down for Viral Tagging and Grow
title_html: BD Influx Cell Sorter Start Up and Shut Down for Viral Tagging and Grow

protocol.title: BD Influx Cell Sorter Start Up and Shut Down for Viral Tagging and Grow
protocol.title_html: BD Influx Cell Sorter Start Up and Shut Down for Viral Tagging and Grow

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: After connecting to cytometer, go to file->workspace->QC Daily-> Courtney URFP file + click “restore laser delays”

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Place empty sheath tank on scale (with lid) and zero the scale and put the waste tank next to it

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Add 3L of MSM to sheath tank for a 1 day run

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Before connecting the lines, clean the connections with a wet kimwipe and MQ then connect all the lines

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Reconnect the fluid lines around the filter

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Rinse O-ring of waste tank before screwing the lid on (to help form a seal)

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Turn on vacuum then Jun Air then the air switch on the right side of FCM

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Add MQ to sonicator and add MQ to syringe + 0.2uM double filter

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Sonicate nozzle tip upright for 30 seconds then upside for ~15 seconds then right side up again for ~15 seconds

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Check stream by using the syringe on the nozzle tip and spraying against the edge of the sink

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Hold syringe upright and suck out excess water then VERY gently shake the rest of the excess out of the nozzle tip

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Without the nozzle tip, add the flush bucket to nozzle area then press rinse and let rinse for two seconds then run for two seconds

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Add nozzle tip

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Click rinse then take out filter from holder and tap it against the metal frame three times and replace the filter then run and backflush for 30 sec to see if sample line is clogged

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Bubble prime the nozzle:

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Turn on the lasers and make sure both lasers are at 100% power before proceeding

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: Remove flush bucket

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: Turn on illum button

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: While watching the stream pane, first adjust the black knobs above the nozzle to get the light centered above the waste drain then adjust the light intensity so it is slightly less than the most intense light possible

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: Watch pin hole and drop pane, use silver knobs (behind the black knobs just used) to finely adjust the stream

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: If the stream and pin hole can’t be aligned try sonicating the nozzle again and restarting at the bubble prime

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: Keep the back flush on and close shutters around nozzle, and press the open circle above where the shutter handle is to turn the laser on

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Before applying rainbow bead sample, adjust sample pressure to +1 what the sheat pressure is at

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Adjust the default display count to 200 and turn the red laser off with the blue laser on (the protruding silver poles on the left side of FCM)

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Vortex ultra rainbow bead for 10 seconds

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Backflush for thirty seconds then add the tube with ultra rainbow beads

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Click acquire on computer then sample on FCM

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Adjust the blue laser with the silver knobs with blue labels to the left of FCM. You want the laser to appear in the middle of the top pin hole

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: You want the value of the median around 45k and the RCV around 2

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Turn the video knob next to the pinhole pane to video 2, adjust with right hand knobs to get an oval shape from the laser not a circle then place the laser over the top pinhole, this is the FSC adjustments and you’ll want a median around 25k for FSC with RCV around 2

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Turn on the red laser, turn back to video 1, and adjust the red laser over the last pin hole with the red, silver knobs to the left of the machine, the value of the median around 45k and the RCV around 2.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Switch the file in QC daily to “Courtney sorting” with laser delays checked

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Close deflection plates and turn on plate button to electrify plates

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Set to 1.0 Drop Pure

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Set drop frequency to 49.4

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Make sure the breakoff camera position is between 151-158

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Adjust the deflection angle to 67 degrees for both side streams

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Turn “test stream” on (not flash charge and short flash).Then, you can see two side streams (left/right) and mainstream (middle), respectively. If two side streams from the mainstream are not bright enough, adjust first the black front facing knob to get all streams bright (if this is done, turn the lasers off and fine adjust the drop/pin hole panes again by adjusting silver knobs (behind the black knobs). Then, turn the test streams on again to check all the streams.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Turn i) test streams ii) flash charge and iii) short flash on and at each step, adjust the piezo amplitude (not frequency) to maximize side stream’s distance from the main stream.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: After adjusting streams, open the more tab and input the camera position number then +/- 20 to the other two variables. Then click set, this will adjust the drop delay number.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Clean drain

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Set the default display count to 2000.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Take out the accudrop bead from the fridge (you can see the precipitate on the bottom of the falcon tube) and vortex vigorously for 10 sec until the precipitate is completely gone. Run the drop delay bead. Click the acquire.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Once you see the plot, adjust the daughter gates to what you expect will be 50/50 of the accudrop bead.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Make a contour plot with SSC y-axis and FSC x-axis

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Click sort ready -> start then flip the knob with the orange tape above it from normal to the unlabeled orange tape (at this stage, you can see two side streams for P1 and P3, respectively).

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Remove bead and backflush for 30 seconds

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: After backflush, label a P1 and P3 tube and check the streams make any adjustments if the stream is being unstable

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: set default display count to 1000

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Set the deflection angle to 45 degrees

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Adjust P1 and P3 gates to where you expect the populations to be

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Take out the 8 peak bead and vortex it for 5-10 sec.

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Run the bead and adjust the gates, first adjust the parent gate in the contour plot (tightly gate the parent population with a 300% zoom) then adjust daughter gates: P1 and P3

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Add tubes, sort ready-> start, then use a paper towel to check that the deflection angle is good and the sorted beads are going into the tubes

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Run P1 and P3 and make sure the its % of parent is high, >95% from the parent is acceptable, want 97-100%.

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Backflush for 30 seconds between samples

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Adjust streams if necessary (by adjusting the piezo value at each step of test stream, flash charge, and short flash),

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Change to 96 well tray sort and remove the 2 tube sorting apparatus then put the 96 well tray in

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Set to deflection angle of 70 degrees then test streams, flash charge, short flash to make sure the piezo amplitude is good

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Change deflection angle to 37 degrees (this will be flexible depending on how well the test stream is placed into the center of A1 well)

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: In the tray control make sure you see 12 dots representing the 12 columns

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Sort ready

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Open the tray control pane. Click the A1 in the sorting pane (not tray control) to use A1 for the sorting test. Use the tray control to move the tray around to get the dot in the center on the directional pad press the center dot to have a test drop come out

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Click the blue circle in the tray control followed by home below the try control (make sure that the sort stream is deflected well from drain). Check the drop of A1 well. Adjust the deflection angle as well as left/right button in the tray control pane to get the drop to be centered on A1.

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: Once the optimization of 96-well sorting is done, set up the FSC, SSC, SybrGold conditions for actual VTG.

source.title: Check 96 Well Tray alignment:

source.description: After you’re done with the sorting return to the 2 tube sorting option (click safe) then start shutdown

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Stop running the sample then backflush for 30s

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Turn off laser

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Run a tube of MQ for 4 minutes

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Turn up the sample pressure to around 23.4 so it rinses the line well

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Leave the tube of MQ there but turn run off the sample button

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Place the flush bucket under the nozzle and then the debubble reservoir

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Fill the reservoir with MQ and make sure nozzle submerged

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Stop the stream then purge for 1 minute to fill line with water

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Stop the purge

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Disconnect form cytometer

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Shutdown cytometer

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Close application

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Shut down computer

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Open plates and turn plate button off. Make sure stream is turned off.

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Turn off auxiliary power

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Remove fluid line on sheath tank

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Set it on the FCM bench

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Open pressure release on sheath tank

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Wait till the pressure in sheath is 0

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Turn air switch off

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Turn main power off

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Turn vacuum and jun air off

source.title: Wet Shutdown - If you plan on using the machine the next day

source.description: Remove lines from waste tank and empty waste tank, replace the waste tank but leave the lines disconnected

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Wash the sample line with 5% contrad for 1 minute. Sample PSI can be increased to around 23.5.

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Run/backflush for 30 seconds.

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Open the shutters in front of the nozzle

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Turn off laser

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Wash sample line with MQW for 4 minutes

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Occasionally (about once a month) place the flush bucket under the nozzle and then the debubble reservoir

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Stop backflush

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Stop the run

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Open the plates and turn the plate button off

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Put the flush bucket under the nozzle

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Depressurize the sheath tank and remove the sheath lines

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: If you think the waste tank is also already filled, you can empty the waste tank in this step and then reconnect the lines

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Dump the rest of the sheath tank then zero the tank again

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Add 1L MQ to the sheath tank and wash down sides w/ MQ, reattach the lines to the sheath tank, close the pressure valve and allow the repressurize

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse and backflush for 1 minutes

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Run and backflush for 2 minutes

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse and backflush until the scale reads 0.16kg then stop the backflush and rinse

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Depressurize sheath tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: DO NOT LET 5% CONTRAD INTO FILTER, disconnect the fluid lines around the filter and reconnect them to each other

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Add 1L of 5% contrad to the sheath tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse and backflush for a few minutes

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Run and backflush for about 4 minutes to clean the sample line with a higher pressure

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse and backflush until 5% contrad runs out

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Depressurize sheath tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Disconnect lines on waste tank then dump the waste tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Dump what is in the sheath tank as well

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Reconnect the waste tank and the sheath tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Zero the scale again (with lid) then add 4L of MQ

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse of the connectors then reattach the fluid and air lines to the sheath tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: If there is a bubble in the nozzle, do a bubble prime to clean the nozzle

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse and backflush till the tank runs out of MQ

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Switch to run and backflush as well

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Disconnect sheath and air lines from the sheath tanks and reconnect them to each other

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Take off the nozzle and put inside the machine

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Rinse and backflush for 5 minutes to dry the machine

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: After the dry time, disconnect the sheath tank to clean it by rinsing three times with MQ

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Clean the sonicator by rinsing with ethanol

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Stop the rinse and backflush

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days
Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Disconnect cytometer -> turn off cytometer -> shut down computer

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Turn off auxiliary power

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Remove waste tank and dumping the contents then rinse with MQ that is inside the tank

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Place both tank upside down next to the sink

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Turn air switch off

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Turn the vacuum off

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Turn the main power off

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Wash sample line with MQW for 5 minutes

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Stop backflush

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Stop the run

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Open the shutters in front of the nozzle

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Turn lasers off

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Open the plates and turn the plate button off

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Put the flush bucket under the nozzle

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Depressurize the sheath tank and remove the sheath lines

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Add 1L MQ water to the sheath tank and wash down sides with the MQ water, reattach the lines to the sheath tank, close the prssure valve and allow to repressurize

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Rinse and backflush for 1 minute and immediately stop the rinse and backflush

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Disconnect the blue connectors (above) from the filters and reconnect them to each other (caution: before disconnecting the blue ones, make sure that MQW completely stops. If not, when you disconnect the blue ones, MQWs spurts out of the lines)

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Do bubble prime for nozzle line with MQW by purge and pulse just for several times since if you repeat this many times then mqw in the sheath tank run out ( this bubble prime also uses the mqw in the sheath tank)

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Rinse and backflush until the sheath tank run out of MQW

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Stop rinse and backflush

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Disconnect the sheath and air lines (silver ones) from the sheath tanks and reconnect them to each other.

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Rinse/backflush to remove any remaining waters from the FCM lines (just for 5 sec?)

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Remove the nozzle tips and put inside the machine

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Rinse and backflush for 5 minutes to dry the machine

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: During the dry time, disconnect the sheath tank (open the depressurized valve on the sheath tank) to clean it by rinsing three times with MQ

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Stop the rinse and backflush

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Disconnect cytometer -> turn off cytometer -> shut down computer

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Turn off auxiliary power

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Remove waste tank rinse with MQ that is inside the tank then dump the rest

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Place both tank upside down next to the sink

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Turn air switch off

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Turn the vacuum off

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: Turn the main power off

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: If the sheath tank runs dry during your run you have to recalibrate the machine with more sheath

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Wait for PSI of 10 in the waste tank

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Close the pressure valve on the sheath tank and turn the air switch on

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Wait for 20 PSI in sheath tank

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Add water to O ring of waste tank to help seal form (to be ~10 psi)

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: If the psi of waste tank does not reach ~10 (e.g., ~5 psi), disassemble and reassemble the lines and lid

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: If clogged, add falcon tube filled with MQ and start sample, if sample light won’t turn on then leave the tube for 1-2 minutes then remove the tube and back flush for 1-2 minutes; repeat process until sample light + backflush work as expected

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Leave backflush on during stream calibration

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: If the machine has been shut down for over a month: add 3.5mL of 0.2uM filtered 70% ethanol to the debubble bucket then purge + pulse to clean the line, rinse the bucket 3x with MQ to clean it

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: After the ethanol wash add debubble bucket with MQ then purge/pulse three times then remove the debubble bucket and allow the machine to run for 10-15 minutes before proceeding to actual bubble prime

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Put the debubble bucket under the nozzle and submerge the nozzle tip in MQ then purge till the line is full of MQ then pulse, repeat a few times

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: If there are still bubbles appearing between the nozzle tip and the line then remove the bucket while purging then replace the bucket with more MQ

source.title: Start up from Dry Shutdown

source.description: Repeat this process till you get three purge/pulse cycles with no (or a very tiny) bubbles in the nozzle.

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: knobs can move the stream forward/backward (to adjust the brightness and focus) and left/right.

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: Remove any water from drain, make sure to not get kimwipe in the drain

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: In the pinhole pane, the stream should be sharply in focus and in line with the pin holes

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: Also you want the top of the nozzle to be slightly visible at the top of the pinhole pane, adjust this with the silver knob pointing straight up

source.title: Calibrating the Stream

source.description: In the drop pane, the stream should be close to the red tape marker

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Sheath pressure should be 22, and the sample pressure around 22.9

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Use the knob facing the front to adjust sample pressure and knob on the right side of FCM for sheath pressure if it is not 22 (but this will not happen often).

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Prioritize making the readings of the beads cluster together in the plots by adjusting two knobs for the blue laser

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Adjust the parameters if necessary (the parameters move the plots)

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Also finely adjust once the beads are clustering and the numbers are close to what you want

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Prioritize making the readings of the beads cluster together in the plots

source.title: Laser calibration with Ultra Rainbow Bead

source.description: Adjust the parameters if necessary

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: When you change the frequency to 49.4, you can see that the shape of the mainstream is immediately changed (in the drop pane)

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: By adjusting drop frequency (to roughly tune drop; ~49.4) and piezo (finely; 2.0-3.5), make the shape, position, & number (5.5) of drops as the figure below.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Caution: If you could not get the shape, position, and number of drop like the figure (above) with the piezo (~2.0-3.5), drop frequency (~49.4), and camera position (151-158), you need to clean the FCM with 5% contrad followed by MQ. Please see the clean the FCM with 5% contrad below.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: If you cannot still see the bright side stream even though adjusting the black/silver knobs, turn off the plate on, open the deflection plate, clean the deflection plate with a wet kimwipe, remove MQ from plate with a dry kimwipe, and let it dry for 10-20min (do not close the plate). If this does not still work well, clean the plates again just with a dry kimwipe. Please put the picture you took here to see what is the best condition.

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Now decrease the drop delay to maximize the side streams and minimize the main streams

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Then stop -> safe-> stop in the software window->stop run the bead

source.title: Drop Delay Calibration with Accudrop Bead:

source.description: Remove paper towel under the two-tube sorting device with a new one and clean any water drops on the two tube sorting set up, which can cause the corrosion

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Run for three minutes

source.title: 8 Peak Bead and Sorting Calibration

source.description: Stop -> safe -> stop in the software window -> stop run the bead -> remove sample -> backflush -> add 150uL of MQ to each sorted population

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Use 0.02m-filtered 70% EtOH followed by washing with MQW three times. Specifically, put 0.02um-filtered 70% EtOH to reservoir and wash the nozzle line by purge and pulse and stop. Take out the reservoir and wash with MQW. Then, place the reservoir under the nozzle and put MQW followed by purge and pulse. Finally, if there is no small bubble in the nozzle, stop the purge and pulse.

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: disconnect the blue-colored connectors (plastic) that are connected to the filters (one is from the sheath line of the sheath tank to filter and the other is from the filter to FCM). Then connect the blues connectors to each other so that 5% contrad from sheath tank can directly go to FCM but not through the filter

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Use the waste in the tank (since it contains contrad) to rinse the sides of the tank at least three times

source.title: Dry Shutown with 5% contrad wash - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days

source.description: Double check that the two tube sorting set-up is in place

source.title: Dry Shutown - if you are shutting the machine down for 3+ days and didn't work with sticky cells

source.description: If you think the waste tank is also already filled, you can empty the waste tank in this step and then reconnect the lines

description: The microbiome is now seen as the engine behind Earth’s nutrient and energy cycles, bioreactor and crop yields, and many diseases in humans, plants and animals. However, evidence is accumulating that viruses of these microbes modulate microbiome impacts. While virus discovery is occurring at a blistering pace, scalable experimental methods to link viruses to hosts, culture them, and phenotype them are needed. Here we improve understanding of a sequencing-enabled ‘Viral Tagging’ (VT) approach, and establish a variant ‘Viral Tag and Grow’ (VT+Grow) to rapidly capture and characterize viruses that infect a cultivated target bacterium, Pseudoalteromonas. First, benchmarking using model systems provided baseline cytometric and microscopy data for understanding how infection conditions and host physiology impact populations in VT flow cytograms. These advances are critical to interpreting, and increasing robustness across this challenging and finicky method. Next, we extensively evaluated and added an ‘and grow’ capability to evaluate where VT signals reflect adsorption alone or wholly successful infections that lead to lysis. Third, we applied VT+Grow to a clonal virus stock, which, coupled to traditional plaque assays, revealed significant variability in burst size – findings that hint at a viral ‘individuality’ parallel to the microbial phenotypic heterogeneity literature. Finally, we established a live protocol for public comment and improvement via protocols.io to maximally empower the research community. Together these efforts provide a robust foundation for VT researchers, and establish VT+Grow as a promising technology to scalably capture and characterize viruses from mixed community source samples that infect cultivable bacteria.
